posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Dwarf has a cha penalty which is bad for sorcerers. Charisma does nothing for a DD and DD does nothing important for a sorcerer.
DD needs BAB +7 to qualify. That means 14 levels of sorcerer before you can take DD. Max BAB will then be 23 with max 3 attacks. On top of that you will not be able to focus heavily on strength to build AB if the caster part of the build is to be taken seriously.
It is possible to build such a character, but it will be weak, both as a caster and warrior.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
It is as Mick said unfortunately, some times we think of cool concepts but for one or the other reason they cannot possibly made into workable builds, especially when we have such huge lvl restrictions. The good thing though is that in this game with it's thousands of possible combinations and feats, there is always some way to get what we want, maybe with another method, but definitely can be done

For example you thought about a Sorcerer/ PM/ DD with the hope you could make a really tough caster, am i right? A sorcerer 26/ PAL 4/ COT 10 or the equivalent would make a much stronger combination, with Epic Warding, Divine Shield & Might, plus Unreal saves and still retain a good spellcasting power, being undispellable and all. Or you could try perhaps a Sorcerer 26/ BG 4/ PM 10 if you want a superb defense. The thing here is that BG is way more powerful than a DD in this build.

I will give you some examples or really strong Spellswords, and you can tell me if you like them.

SPELLSWORD OF BAHAMUT => spellsword-of-bahamut-sorc-26-paladin-4-rdd-10-t515415.html
DRAGONIC ARCANIST => draconic-arcanist-wizard-26-bard-4-rdd-10-t2344104.html
THE AUGUST SPELL-BLADE => http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 00792.html
SORCERER KING => http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 72583.html

All of them are fully armoured/ Undispellable Casters with a strong melee presence, the last one has PM in it as well.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I will answer to your question, but something tells me that you still haven't taken a good look at the builds i linked to you. Cause i linked to you what's best of the best already, builds that can tear apart a server. Anyway, let's move to your question and let me show you why sometimes just throwing 3 powerful classes together won't work.

1) Charisma is your best stat in this build, it is luckily to be well over 42 buffed at lvl forty. Yet, there is no class from these three to take real advantage of it. Neither Paladin nor Blackguard to transfer this massive Charisma as a bonus to your saves or make it Divine damage or Armour Class via DM/DS.

2) The weird restriction of 20 Sorcerer lvls before a single lvl of Pale Master along with the RDD, make for a build that almost never mature but to the last possible lvls. It is like a carrot dangling in front of a rabbit that is trying to catch it but never quite succeed in doing so. If you attempt to build such a character all the good things will come amongst 35-40 lvls. Before that you will be a sad imitation of a caster with an undead dragonic heritage.

3) In this class split there is absolutely no epic bonus feats whatsoever. Moreover, the luck of epic Sorcerer lvls means that you cannot qualify for epic spells at all, so no epic mage armour or epic warding for you. And these are amongst the best epic feats a Sorcerer can take. Furthermore you will have difficulty even acquiring base feats for your class with so few epic feats available.

4) With just 20 Sorcerer lvls you will be dispellable even from greater dispels that every single epic mob will have and throw at you. A couple of them and you are suddenly without all those juicy buffs you just spend 10 minutes casting. And then you will die, horribly so. Furthermore you will have too low a penetration to affect any serious opponent with your spells, so again you will be left with a caster that is forced to resort in melee combat most of the time.

5) With no full BAB classes at all and with so many 1/2 BAB classes thowed in you will be left with a very low AB compared to other spellswords. And you will have to spend general feats to take even the most basics, like martial weapon proficiency.


There are more actually but i feel that i illustrated my point about this class mixture,fairly well. The point is, that unless you are looking for an RP character, power-gaiming wise this combo simply won't work for you. You are better off, if you simply choose something from the builds i linked to you before or another possible combo that actually works. Both of your suggestions although they sound like interesting characters are simply non-viable for a competitive environment.


I hope i helped you,

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Unless something is eluding me, there is simply no need for him to take that Palmaster lvl pre-epic, in fact it is way more beneficial to keep adding Sorcerer lvls instead. You can move that Palemaster lvl in epics along with the rest of them. Perhaps he took that lvl for saving some skill points and not forced to cross-class Hide for the Blackguard requirements. I do know why he took the fourth BG lvl at forty, but i cannot see why he took the first Pale master lvl so early except for the saving of five skill points and the early boost of +2 AC. My suggestion would simply move that PM lvl at Epics along with the rest of them. Sorcerer 26/ BG 4/ PM 10 is a very nice build, although i would change some things if i did it myself, but anyway it will cover you nicely for what you want.

You third suggestion, has an alignment confilct, does your server allow these kind of builds?

Also keep something in mind for future reference. If the build you have in mind does not have any Charisma synergy between it's classes, then you are simply much better to make this with a Wizard instead of a Sorcerer. Wizard will give you way more skills, five more feats and loose nothing. Sorcerers are only used when we want a Charisma synergy between the classes. Instead of Sorcerer 20/ Pm 10/ XX 10 you should go with Wizard 26/ PM 10/ XX 4, that is much, much better. For example Wizard 26/ Fighter 4/ PM 10 would make a nice build perhaps for what you want, which is a Caster that has PM immunities & AC and can carry with some efficiency a longsword. Another possibility that also get Epic spells, is Wizard 20/ Fighter 4/ PM 16 for +4 AC more, but he will be dispellable.
